description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever
a managed network element turns unreachable (ICMP).
This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever
a managed network element is reachable via ICMP but not reachable via the Management protocol (SNMP / TL1 )
This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to clear the
unreachable / not manageable events raised previously.
This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever it
encounters / discovers a Network element running an Unsupported software version.

Summary.eval: ($v3 ne '') ? '$v3' : 'Network element running an unsupported software version ($v2)'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::unSupportedNetworkElementVersion MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress a 192.0.2.1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementSoftwareVersion s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp s EXAMPLEE

description: This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: Indicates the current firmware version of the Network Element being Managed
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementSoftwareVersion

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever it
could not login to the CLI (or TL1) session of the Network Element using the supplied
Credentials
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::cliLoginFailed MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress a 192.0.2.1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::cliUserName s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp s EXAMPLEE

description: This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: Indicates the User Name used to open the CLI Session with the Network Element
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::cliUserName

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) upon its
Failure to send the E-Mail Notification to NB Clients registered for E-Mail Notification

Summary.eval: ($v2 ne '') ? '$v2' : 'E-Mail notification sending to registered NB clients failed'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmEmailNotificationFailure MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::notificationAddress s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp s EXAMPLEE

description: Indicates the E-Mail Address used for Notification
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::notificationAddress

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Indicates a Failure during Data Collection.
NB managers can either ignore it (or) log-it.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::dataCollectionFailure MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress a 192.0.2.1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricName s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp s EXAMPLEE

description: This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: Name of the Metric being collected.
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricName

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report
a Threshold Crossing Alert, whenever the Threshold limit is crossed for the current
Performance Metric

Summary.eval: ($v6 ne '') ? '$v6' : ($v2==1) ? 'Performance metric threshold crossed alarm cleared' : 'Performance metric threshold crossed alarm occurred'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerPerfMetricRaiseAndClearTCA MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress a 192.0.2.1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricThresholdSeverityIndex i 1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricName s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricCollectedValue i 9999 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricThresholdLimit i 9999 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp s EXAMPLEE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricThresholdDeltaValue i 1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricThresholdMonInterval u 9999

description: This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: Unique severity level of this Threshold
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricThresholdSeverityIndex

description: Name of the Metric being collected.
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricName

description: Value of the Performance Metric Collected at the Respective Collected Time
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricCollectedValue

description: Limit for Raising a Alarm.
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricThresholdLimit

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: To identify the threshold value whether it is a delta value or not.
If the value is true then the threshold value is a Delta value
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricThresholdDeltaValue

description: Threshold Monitor Interval (in seconds)
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::perfMetricThresholdMonInterval

description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report
an Alarm Raised due to the occurrence of a trap from the Network Element.
Severity List includes Cleared. the Clear Alarm should clear the previous raise Alarm.
The combination of networkElementIPAddress, sourceComponent (if any), alarmCategory (if available)
and alarmSeverity shall be used to uniquely identify a specific root cause

Summary.eval: ($v5 ne '') ? '$v5' : ($v4==1) ? 'Alarm raised from the network element is cleared' : 'Alarm raised due to the occurence of trap from the network element'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmFromNetworkElement MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress a 192.0.2.1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::sourceComponent s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmCategory s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmSeverity i 1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp s EXAMPLEE

description: This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: Indicates the Component within the Router / Switch responsible for the problem. It is represented in Shelf-Slot-Port format
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::sourceComponent

description: Category Assigned for the Alarm. Used as a place holder to differentiate different types of
Traps that can be raised from the same component of the equipment
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmCategory

description: This object indicates the severity of alarm. Clear severity will be used
to clear the previously raised alarm
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Management server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report an Misc Alarm raised by Management Server.

Summary.eval: ($v5 ne '') ? '$v5' : ($v4==1) ? 'Misc alarm cleared' : 'Misc alarm raised by management server'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::miscAlarmsFromMgmtServer MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress a 192.0.2.1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::sourceComponent s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmCategory s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmSeverity i 1 MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData s EXAMPLE MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp s EXAMPLEE

description: This is used to indicate the IP-Address of the Network Element serving as the root cause of the problem
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::networkElementIPAddress

description: Indicates the Component within the Router / Switch responsible for the problem. It is represented in Shelf-Slot-Port format
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::sourceComponent

description: Category Assigned for the Alarm. Used as a place holder to differentiate different types of
Traps that can be raised from the same component of the equipment
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmCategory

description: This object indicates the severity of alarm. Clear severity will be used
to clear the previously raised alarm
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Indicates a Switch-over of the Management server from primary to Standby Server.
Note: This alarm will be triggered only when the Management Server is deployed in a Primary - HotStandBy mode.

Summary.eval: ($v1 ne '') ? '$v1' : 'Switch-over of the management server from primary to standby server'

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp

description: Indicates that the Primary Management Server has been restored back in Service.
Note: This alarm will be triggered only when the Management Server is deployed in a Primary - HotStandBy mode.

Summary.eval: ($v1 ne '') ? '$v1' : 'Primary management server restored back in service'

description: This is used as a place holder to include detailed alarm message
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDiagnosticData

description: This object specifies Time at which the Alarm is triggered by the Mgmt Server
variables.name: MgmtServer-NOTIFICATION-MIB::mgmtServerTimeStamp
